member.name: T:BitlyDotNET.Implementations.BitlyService
member.summary: Implements the IBitlyService interface

member.name: T:BitlyDotNET.Interfaces.IBitlyService
member.summary: Defines the interface for communicating with the bit.ly API

member.name: M:BitlyDotNET.Interfaces.IBitlyService.Shorten(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Encodes a long URL as a shorter one, put it in and returns the StatusCode of the request.
member.param: Contains a long URL if successful, null otherwise.
member.returns: The status code of the request
member.exception: is not a well formed URL (see remarks).
A critical error occured that prevented the function to succesfully contact the Bitly API (see remarks).

remarks.para: When an exception of type BitlyDotNETException is thrown, you can examine the Reason member of the exception to further diagnose the problem.
The parameter shouldn't be URL-escaped as a whole, but any parameters in the query string should be.

member.name: M:BitlyDotNET.Interfaces.IBitlyService.Shorten(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a long URL as a shorter one and returns it.
member.returns: The short URL corresponding to if successful, null otherwise.
member.exception: is not a well formed URL (see remarks).
A critical error occured that prevented the function to succesfully contact the Bitly API (see remarks).

remarks.para: When an exception of type BitlyDotNETException is thrown, you can examine the Reason member of the exception to further diagnose the problem.
The parameter shouldn't be URL-escaped as a whole, but any parameters in the query string should be.

member.name: T:BitlyDotNET.Exceptions.Reason
member.summary: Defines the possible reasons for the library to throw an exception

member.name: F:BitlyDotNET.Exceptions.Reason.CallForbidden
member.summary:
The library was unable to initiate a call to the API due to a lack of permissions.
Usually, this happens when a System.Net.WebPermission is thrown by the framework. You might want to add the following line in your config files to resolve this issue:

member.name: F:BitlyDotNET.Exceptions.Reason.MethodNotFound
member.summary: The requested file/method could not be found on the remote server

member.name: F:BitlyDotNET.Exceptions.Reason.UnableToParseResponse
member.summary: The API returned data in an unexpected format

member.name: T:BitlyDotNET.Exceptions.BitlyDotNETException
member.summary: Represents an exception that can be thrown by the library when a critical condition prevents a successful communication with the API.

member.name: P:BitlyDotNET.Exceptions.BitlyDotNETException.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason behind the creation of this exception
